story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in Sudan, there was a kind and curious little boy named Yasin. Yasin loved to explore the world around him, and he would often ask his mother, Nura, questions about the stars, the animals, and the people in their village.

One night, as Yasin was getting ready for bed, he asked his mother to tell him a bedtime story. Nura smiled and began to tell him a story that had been passed down in their family for generations.

"Once upon a time," she began, "there was a magical bird that lived in the desert. This bird had beautiful feathers of every color, and it could sing the most beautiful songs that had the power to heal the sick and bring happiness to those who heard it.

But the bird was very shy, and it only came out to sing during the full moon. Many people from all over the world would travel to the desert to try to catch a glimpse of the magical bird, but none were ever successful.

One day, a kind and gentle boy named Yasin heard about the magical bird and decided that he wanted to see it for himself. He packed a small bag with some food and water, and he set out on a journey to find the bird.

He traveled for many days and nights, crossing vast deserts and climbing tall sand dunes. He faced many challenges along the way, but his determination never wavered.

Finally, after many days of traveling, Yasin arrived at the place where the magical bird was said to live. He waited patiently for the full moon to rise, and when it did, he heard the most beautiful song he had ever heard.

As he looked up at the sky, he saw the magical bird flying above him, singing its enchanting song. The bird saw Yasin and was moved by his kind heart and determination to find it. The bird flew down and landed on Yasin's shoulder, and from that day on, the two became the best of friends.

Yasin and the magical bird traveled the world together, bringing happiness and healing to all those they met. And whenever Yasin needed guidance or strength, the magical bird would sing its beautiful song, filling his heart with courage and hope.

The end."

Yasin's eyes were wide with wonder as he listened to his mother's story. "Mother, is that a true story?" he asked.

Nura smiled and nodded. "It is a true story, Yasin. It is the story of the magical bird that lives in all of us. Whenever we are kind and have a good heart, the magical bird sings and brings happiness and healing to those around us."

Yasin hugged his mother tight and drifted off to sleep, dreaming of magical birds and adventures.

The end.

I hope you and your son will enjoy this bedtime story, and it will bring you closer together. good night.
